View and Download Default GSM and LTE Profiles

Use this task to view and download Global System for Mobile (GSM) profiles (2G) and Long-Term Evolution (LTE) profiles (4G) for service provider networks. Any profile that you download can be modified and uploaded later. Thereafter, this profile can be assigned and applied to vNodes.

  1. In the navigation bar, click Profiles > Summary.
  2. In the Profiles window, the default LTE profiles and GSM profile display displays as shown below:
  3. If you want to find a TR-69 parameter name that is associated with a particular profile, enter it in the Profile details search window, below the list of profiles.
  4. To download a default LTE or GSM profile to your local system in order to make parameter changes, click the download icon in the Action column for the profile you want and save the .json file to your local system directory. When you open the default configuration file in an editor, such as notepad, the json file is unformatted. For example, the following json output is shown unformatted for the LTE RRC Timers.json default profile, which can be problematic when editing large profile configuration files:
    We recommend using a tool to validate and format the configuration file so you can easily make changes to the file. For example, the following json output for the LTE RRC Timers.json default profile has been reformatted so that it is easier to make parameter changes:
